metadata.title: CVE-2018-18500 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur while parsing an HTML5 stream inconcert with custom HTML elements. This results in the stream parser objectbeing freed while still in use, leading to a potentially exploitable crash.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.5, Firefox ESR < 60.5, andFirefox < 65.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.5.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
